publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1340 Mr Keith Harding: Homelessness in Fife-That the Parliament notes that homelessness in Fife has risen 38% over the past three years, affecting 3,388 households and that the figures for Scotland show an increase of 12% over the same period; further notes that this has occurred at a time when Fife Council has failed to collect millions of pounds of rent arrears and lost income from unlet properties, and recognises that these resources could have been used to bring unlet homes back into use or for better computer systems to match people to homes as part of a programme to help alleviate homelessness in the Kingdom.
S1M-1340 Homelessness in Fife (lodged on 10 November 2000) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-1340# Homelessness in Fife (lodged on 10 November 2000) Mr Brian Monteith*
S1M-1340# Homelessness in Fife (lodged on 10 November 2000) Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Alex Fergusson*, John Scott*
S1M-1340# Homelessness in Fife (lodged on 10 November 2000) Bill Aitken*

S1M-1340# Mr Keith Harding: Homelessness in Fife-That the Parliament notes that homelessness in Fife has risen 38% over the past three years, affecting 3,388 households and that the figures for Scotland show an increase of 12% over the same period; further notes that this has occurred at a time when Fife Council has failed to collect millions of pounds of rent arrears and lost income from unlet properties, and recognises that these resources could have been used to bring unlet homes back into use or for better computer systems to match people to homes as part of a programme to help alleviate homelessness in the Kingdom. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Mr Brian Monteith, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Alex Fergusson, John Scott, Bill Aitken
S1M-1340# Homelessness in Fife (lodged on 10 November 2000) Mr Jamie McGrigor*

S1M-1340# Mr Keith Harding: Homelessness in Fife—That the Parliament notes that homelessness in Fife has risen 38% over the past three years, affecting 3,388 households and that the figures for Scotland show an increase of 12% over the same period; further notes that this has occurred at a time when Fife Council has failed to collect millions of pounds of rent arrears and lost income from unlet properties, and recognises that these resources could have been used to bring unlet homes back into use or for better computer systems to match people to homes as part of a programme to help alleviate homelessness in the Kingdom. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Mr Brian Monteith, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Alex Fergusson, John Scott, Bill Aitken, Mr Jamie McGrigor

S1M-1340# Mr Keith Harding: Homelessness in Fife-That the Parliament notes that homelessness in Fife has risen 38% over the past three years, affecting 3,388 households and that the figures for Scotland show an increase of 12% over the same period; further notes that this has occurred at a time when Fife Council has failed to collect millions of pounds of rent arrears and lost income from unlet properties, and recognises that these resources could have been used to bring unlet homes back into use or for better computer systems to match people to homes as part of a programme to help alleviate homelessness in the Kingdom. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Mr Brian Monteith, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Alex Fergusson, John Scott, Bill Aitken, Mr Jamie McGrigor

Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Mr Brian Monteith, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Alex Fergusson, John Scott, Bill Aitken, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Phil Gallie

S1M-1340# Mr Keith Harding: Homelessness in Fife-That the Parliament notes that homelessness in Fife has risen 38% over the past three years, affecting 3,388 households and that the figures for Scotland show an increase of 12% over the same period; further notes that this has occurred at a time when Fife Council has failed to collect millions of pounds of rent arrears and lost income from unlet properties, and recognises that these resources could have been used to bring unlet homes back into use or for better computer systems to match people to homes as part of a programme to help alleviate homelessness in the Kingdom.
